[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 70]
Reasoning: **Analyzing card strategy**

I'm considering whether to aim for trips or to keep pairs. With a 9-card hand, I can discard up to 5 cards, focusing on keeping the most promising ones. I think about sticking with my pairs and high cards, but I need to decide which cards might help me build towards a better hand. Ultimately, keeping both 8s and some high cards while discarding others seems like a good strategy. Discarding 5 would still leave me with a 9-card hand since I'd draw 5 new cards.
**Evaluating card options**

I'm trying to figure out if keeping my spades (A, K, J) for a possible flush is worth it. I currently have 3 spades, and there are 7 left in the deck. I could try discarding some cards, but a flush seems insufficient as it wouldn’t give me enough chips. Instead, aiming for either a full house or four of a kind seems more promising. With Zany, I could potentially score significantly higher, so focusing on those options might be the best path forward.
**Calculating hand values**

I'm working on a strategy for forming a full house. It seems like I could potentially score around 2k for that. If I stick with three of a kind, it’s looking like I’d get about 1.2k instead, which isn't quite enough. Achieving multiple full houses is difficult, but with three hands left, I should aim for at least one full house and maybe a few three of a kinds to boost my total. I want to leverage my pair of 8s to aim for trips and create a full house with additional pairs too.
**Strategizing discards**

I think the best plan is to use discards to aim for a third 8 and possibly another pair. I'm considering which cards to let go of, maybe A♠, K♠, J♠, and 2♣, but should I keep 4♦ and 7♦? Honestly, it's tough to decide what to keep when I can only discard 5 cards. I definitely want to hold onto the pair of 8s, but maybe I should keep higher duplicates for better chances instead. Since I’ll draw 5 new cards if I discard 5, it’s all about maximizing my opportunities!
**Calculating discard strategy**

I'm thinking about the probability of drawing another 8. With 2 eights left in a 25-card deck, I calculated that the chances of getting at least one 8 is about 36.7%, which isn't too shabby! If I keep my pairs, it might reduce my chances. I need to decide which 5 cards to discard, possibly letting go of lower cards while keeping high ranks for potential pairs. Keeping both 8s along with an Ace and a King sounds like the best plan, so I think I’ll discard the J♠, 5♥, 2♣, 7♦, and 4♦. Then, I'll draw 5 new cards and evaluate my hand.

Command: discard 3 5 7 8 9

I’ll select cards 1, 4, 8, 3, and 6 for my hand, ensuring it’s the best possible. The estimated score is 1890, so I’ll be crafting a JSON action accordingly.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
